name: The Salutation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot recommend the Salutation highly enough. The rooms and communal areas are perfect and it feels like a real luxury stay. Brfeakfast was amazing as well as all of the little extra's in the room and the cottages. Its one of the best places i have ver stayed and has everything you could possibly want. The afternoon tea in the tea room is phenomenal and the gardens are beautiful and right on your doorstep. I stayed in the St Georges Room in Knightrider House and it was perfect.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay in perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay here, the hosts are so welcoming and staff are always happy.
reviews.title: The Perfect Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are stunning with lots of character & the attention to detail stands out as pure luxury, breakfast was amazing, the dining room just blows you away when you walk in, you feel like a king & queen. We didn't get to walk around the gardens as we ran out of time, but we will definately do this on our return visit.
reviews.title: This is the best i have ever been to !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a perfect place for a proposal :-) and to share it with friends made it even more special. We wouldnt hesitate booking our wedding here in the future & look forward to having all our friends join us again. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay.
reviews.title: Wondrous - your secret bolt hole from the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just come back from a one -night stay in The Coach House at this fantastic B&B. The beautifull accommodation offers every thing you could want !!! the breakfast is one of the best i have ever had !! and that is in the main house where each place setting is carefully placed just for your sumptuous breakfasts
reviews.title: An Absolute Pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying at The Salutation's, Knightrider House in the St George's suite and could not have wished for anything more. The attention to detail is amazing, from your own bar in the beautiful lounge (all included in price) to the sherry & whisky on your dresser for a quick evening tipple all add to the personal charm of the stay. Breakfast is in the main house looking out onto the terrace and gardens, the food expertly prepared by their charming chef. The welcoming and friendly staff all ensure you feel like you have always lived here! The bedroom (and en-suite) are wonderful and the bed sumptuous making it difficult to leave the house and venture out. When you do there is the famous Secret Gardens and picturesque Sandwich village to explore, with its quaint shops and not a chain store in site! How they have kept the usual coffee suspects away is a credit to the local council. Their is a tea room (open spring to late autumn - so we have to come back) and a small gift shop on the grounds (linked to the Secret Garden ao plant lovers can get their fix here). Dominic and the team at the Salutation have invested heavily in this famous estate and we are sure that it will continue to be the place to go for affordable luxury in Kent. We are already planning our next visit, this time with family and friends too. 10/10
reviews.title: The place to stay in Kent

reviews.text: I have recently returned from a two-night stay in The Coach House at this quite exceptional B&B. The luxurious accommodation offers all that one might expect to find in a five star hotel and is located in a series of beautifully converted historic outbuildings adjacent to the main house where sumptuous breakfasts are served up to the very civilised hour of 10.00am Service is of high quality quality - nothing is too much trouble. Apart from the attractive supremely comfortable bedrooms and bathrooms, each building has its own unbelievably well-equipped and pristine kitchen and large, beautifully furnished sitting room with a well-stocked complimentary bar. Outside, there is the opportunity to enjoy more than three acres of stunning gardens originally designed by Gertrude Jekyll and Sir Edwin Lutyens and all restored to their former glory in recent years. Sheer bliss!
reviews.title: Supreme Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights in June 2012. We stayed in the Gardner's cottage, which is really a separate 3 bedroom apt. with a living room and kitchen, etc., but we only occupied one bedroom -- no one else stayed in the apt. It would have been a good arrangement for a family -- roomy but only one bathroom, 3 bedrooms, great well equipt kitchen with a separate ice maker, free"mini-bar" ( yes, drinks were available no additional charge), lots of space. Easy parking out front in the parking lot for the hotel and gardens.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in Sandwich, near Dover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The owner is a very personable gentleman, very helpful. Nice breakfast in their main house dining room, shared at the large dining room table that seats about 24 people or so. Very elegant.
reviews.title: Really Lovely
A great secret place
reviews.text: The property also has a couple of acres of gardens open to the public ( for a fee-no charge if you are a guest) which are very pleasant to walk around, particularly after they close to the general public. There is also a tea room near the road.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The town of Sandwich is also a pretty little place, with some decent restaurants and shops very close by. ( Eat at the George and Dragon--very good)
reviews.title: A great place to stay. Loved it

description: The Salutation is perhaps one of the finest places to stay in Kent. With eight new beautiful bedrooms in the Salutation manor house and nine beautiful bedrooms within three charming self-contained cottages which feature a fully-fitted kitchen, spacious living areas and a complimentary bar, The Salutation accommodation provides a truly bespoke, relaxing and eloquent stay. Every room is furnished with duck down pillows and duvets and sumptuous Egyptian cotton sheets for a relaxing night's stay, and many overlook the glorious three-and-a-half acres of Lutyens and Jekyll gardens. Expect nothing but the highest standards and exceptional service when staying at any one of the properties and enjoy full access to The award-winning Secret Gardens of Sandwich, located to the rear of the main house.
